lines.text: You look so different in those clothes.
I'm different all the time.
You married?
Sure, who's not?
You and your wife fight... argue all the time?
Some of the time she sleeps.
Seventy eight percent of the pilots in Skyway Airlines are married. Ya' see, you get married, you become a statistic.
Yeah... Stay single, and you wind up talkin' to bartenders.
Are you the girl in 809?
Why, yes. Who's this?
I'm the guy in 821. Across the court. Can I ask you a question?
I don't know. I suppose so. Are you sure you want me?
Yeah. You're the one I want, alright. Are you doing anything you couldn't be doing better with somebody else?
I guess I'll have to hang up!
Why? You cant get hurt on the telephone.
Who are you?
I told you. The man across the way. A lonely soul.
You sound peculiar.
I'm not peculiar. I'm just frustrated. I got a bottle of rye. And as I waas saying, what are you doing?
What's your name?
Billy.
Oh...
What's the matter? Don't you like Billy?
The female race is always cheesing up my life!
You smell like a cooch dancer!
Does that mean come on over?
Yes. If you like.
Two minutes.
Why didn't you tell me you were working here?
I'm not. I'm just doing it for tonight.
Yeah, I know. You're an heiress. Tomorrow morning, you'll ride through your estate side saddled.
She made you say that!
"look, I believe in a drink, a kiss or a laugh now and then". And that's the way it would be. "Fine" she said, I can hear her saying it now. "Fine, I like to laugh".
I still like to laugh. But not at myself. I just don't want any of it any more. Life's too long.
Alright, I'll send you a valentine. What do you want? Hearts and flowers? Forever and ever? Love?
Don't be afraid to say it. It's not a dirty word.
Go back to Chicago. Find another bar. Find another girl.
And find another wedding ring? Marriage isn't the answer to everything you know.
Who's talking about marriage?
Weren't you?
No. But I'm sure that's all you thought I had on my mind. That's where you're wrong. That's just the point. I wouldn't want to marry you.
Why not?
It's something to do with the way you are.
They're all finished Mr. We got a new process that develops them right away.
I'm not angry; I'm just furious.
Did you fly a bomber during the war?
Who didn't?

[after Bunny has been untied]
My goodness, Bunny, what have they done to you?
Oh, mommy... that lady!
I know, dear. I guess we've never seen anybody like her.
Are you alright?
Yes.
I'm frightened! I think something's happened!
[first lines]
After all, we guests who live here from year to year, we deserve a little consideration, too.
After all, if anything dreadful is going on upstairs, it's our duty to do something about it.

[Preoccupied with his stamp collection]
Don't be a peeping pansy. Leave 'em alone.
I think we should call the house detective.
Huh. That one! He couldn't detect a monk in a convent!
Well, heaven only knows what's going on right across the way.

[to elevator operator]
You're lucky to have such a steady job.
Oh - it has it's ups and downs - most people laugh at that one, sir.
